text: Is there a way to run doctests in a way that makes sure they don’t throw an errors but doesn’t actually check the output?

elements.text: Is there a way to run doctests in a way that makes sure they don’t throw an errors but doesn’t actually check the output?

text:
so the doctests are literal string equality tests, so it _only_ tests the output. You might be able to hack it by having doctests with no outputs (using `;` after all lines) or you could use the
```julia> expr
[...]```
syntax which tells documenter to ignore the output below that line
